alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 30 at 4:51PM MST until December 30 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 80 mph expected. The strongest winds earlier today peaked near 110 mph at the base of the foothills, but overall winds should gradually weaken through the evening hours. * WHERE...Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet/Gilpin/Clear Creek/Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet, Larimer County Below 6000 Feet/Northwest Weld County and Boulder and Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet/West Broomfield County Counties. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds below 6000 feet are expected to be near the base of the foothills from Boulder north to Fort Collins to the Wyoming border. Strong west winds and low hudidities will continue to cause the potential for rapid fire spread.
info.instruction: Remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Watch for falling debris and tree limbs. Use caution if you must drive. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County
